p: Also influencing zoonotic diseases in which the human is an accidental host that temporarily or permanently maintains the disease such as the Ebola virus (Filoviridae) and the severe acute respiratory syndrome virus (SARS–Coronaviridae) ( Plowright et al., 2015, O’Shea et al., 2014). The presence of vectors such as arthropods easily mobilizes infection in humans such as Leishmania, Plasmodium, Ehrlichia, chikungunya, dengue, and encephalitis ( Bender and Shulman, 2004, Parrish et al., 2008).
